document.docAuthor: Barahona-Segovia, Rodrigo M., Riera, Pamela, Pañinao-Monsálvez, Laura, Guzmán, Vicente Valdés & Henríquez-Piskulich, Patricia
document.masterDocTitle: Updating the knowledge of the flower flies (Diptera: Syrphidae) from Chile: Illustrated catalog, extinction risk and biological notes

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Updating the knowledge of the flower flies (Diptera: Syrphidae) from Chile: Illustrated catalog, extinction risk and biological notes

figureCitation.captionText: FIGURE 56–61. Palpada chilena (Rondani, 1863): (56) male visiting a Lantara camara L., Santiago (photo by Orlando Montes); (57) female resting in a leave, Pucón (Photo by Miguel Mellado). Palpada elegans (Blanchard, 1852): (58) female visiting a Trifolium sp., Santiago (photo by Matías Cortés); (59) male visiting an Asteraceae, Lago Lanalhue (photo by Edgardo Flores). Palpada meigenii (Wiedemann, 1830): (60) males visiting Foeniculum vulgare Mill., Biobío river (photo by Orlando Montes); (61) female resting, Puerto Montt (photo by Matías Cortés).

bibRefCitation.author: Blanchard, E.
bibRefCitation.refString: Blanchard, E. (1852) Orden IX. Dipteros. In: Gay, C. (Ed.), Historia fisica y politica de Chile. Zoologia. Vol. 7. Published by Author, Paris & Museo de Historia Natural, Santiago, pp. 471.

bibRefCitation.author: Schiner, I. R.
bibRefCitation.refString: Schiner, I. R. (1868) Diptera. In: von Wullerstorf-Urbair, B. (Ed.), Reise der osterreichischen Fregatte Novara um die Erde in den Jahren 1857, 1858, 1859, unter den Befehlen des Commodore B. von Wullerstorf-Urbair. K. Gerold, Vienna, pp. 1 - 388.

.

Chilean distribution. From Coquimbo to Los Lagos region ( Fig. 65 ).
Altitudinal range. From coastal to highland ecosystems (5– 3,000 m .a.s.l.).

Biology and notes.
Palpada elegans
is a generalist species associated with disturbed and native ecosystems. According to
Smith-Ramírez et al. (2005)
P. elegans
visits flowers of
A. luma
,
A. altenifolia
,
E. cordifolia
,
M. ovata var. ovata
,
M. planipes
,
Rhaphithamnus spinosus (Juss.) Moldenke
and
T. stipularis (
Smith-Ramírez et al., 2005
)
. Others records have been made it visiting
Achillea millfolium
L. (Ricardo Huenuanca, CSP record);
Baccharis
sp. (Matías Cortés , CSP record);
Haplopappus foliosus (Hook. & Arn.) Hook. & Arn.
(Tabatha Carrera, CSP records) and
Mentha
sp. (Tity Rodríguez, CSP record),
Conservation status. LC; EOO = 161,994 km 2 ; AOO = 104 km 2 , 24 subpopulations and 25 localities.
